html:
** Shares in Dassault Systemes DAST.PA rise 3%, bringing their price to new heights and the stock to the top of France's blue-chip CAC 40 .FCHI index and among top performers of the STOXX 600 .STOXX, after the French software company raised its 2021 guidance on the back of surging Q2 sales (Full Story)

** With Q2 results slightly above consensus, Dassault Systemes raises its 2021 non-IFRS revenue guidance to 4.75-4.79 bln euros ($5.60-$5.65 bln), from 4.72-4.77 bln euros previously

** It raises its 2021 non IFRS EPS guidance to 0.89-0.91 euros from 0.85-0.86 euros previously, adjusting for the company's five-for-one stock split earlier this month

** "Dassault saw solid broad-based global demand, especially in transportation and mobility and life sciences and healthcare," says JP Morgan, while Oddo BHF anticipates better-than-expected trends off the "very impressive" Q2 and guidance hike

** JPM predicts that 2021 non-IFRS net profit and EPS consensus could now be raised by some 5%, while Citi expects EPS and core profit estimates to move up by low- to mid-single digit percentages

** This should bode well for software peers such as Hexagon HEXAb.ST, Aveva AVV.L, Siemens Digital SIEGn.DE, PTC PTC.O and Autodesk ADSK.O, it adds

** Today's gains added 1.7 billion euros to Dassault Systemes' market value


($1 = 0.8482 euros)


(Reporting by Sarah Morland)

(( sarah.morland@tr.com ))
